I liked the unique subtle hints of orange in a thinly fried donut. Great service, really sweet server who accommodated us despite us being the last party there on a Monday night.
author: Joyce H.

description: You can always expect one of the best meals here.  Gerald always does great job.
author: Steve A.

description:
Kind of dull, kind of boring.  This place deserves a three-star A-ok.  

I've developed quite a discerning palate eating such amazing food in this city.  My overall impression of Piperade:  For the price tag, the food just doesn't shine in San Francisco's exceptional food scene.  Although they offer a wide variety of options, nothing caught the attention of my taste buddies.   Not to mention that the food lacked freshness.    

I had this mushroom tart or something for dinner (see what I mean--I can't even remember!), then the apricot tartlet for dessert.  I swear, they used the exact same puff pastry for both.  Am I mistaken about the dual-functioning puff?  I really hope that I am.  Either way, a deja vous experience in one meal is a major faux paux.

Outside of the food, the ambiance is quasi-stuffy.  And the service is just ok.  

Am I happy for the opportunity to eat even more food?!  Of course!  With that said though, Piperade's nothing to write home to mom about.
author: Angella S.

description:
Was hoping to grab a bite from the falafel wench's truck, but  she obviously has no concept of maximizing operations so I had to grab a bite elsewhere.  I was a tad hesitant about Piperade To Go since it looked like a Dean & Deluca store front, but thankfully it proved to have much more personality than a generic corporate lunch take away joint.

Chicken Mr. Williams Sandwich:  Lightly crisped like a milanese cutlet rather than something extra crispy from Popeye's.  Fresh avocados added a creamy element while roasted red peppers add smokiness and a slight vinegar edge.  Always a fan of the sharp manchego.  Love that they toast the roll with a panini press for a good texture accent.  An amazing sandwich for a merely crappy deli price.
author: Adam B.

description:
The first time I went to Piperade a year or so ago, I had a lovely dining experience.  Service, ambience and the food were great.  So when I recommended it for a work dinner for 8 of us, I expected more of the same.  Sadly, I was wrong.

The food as always, was terrific.  Every dish we ate was delicious and cooked exactly as we would have liked it.

The glaring issue this time was service. Our server was downright useless and felt like a banquet waiter serving 100 people in a Las Vegas hotel ballroom.  He took a half hour to first come to our table and subsequent visits were rushed, perfunctory and entirely reactive.  Not once did he make suggestions on menu items, offer to pour our wine or even ask us if we wanted anything.  We'd have to flag him down, order and/or ask for additional items including water and wine and then wait another half hour for him to show up again.  Between orders, we'd get our dishes nearly thrown down on our tables by expeditors and buss boys.  Our waiter would come by a couple of times to ask "are you enjoying" and then quickly disappear.  Because of his constant absence, our dinner took nearly 3 hours from start to finish, which would have been ok were we having fun instead of waiting for long periods between courses and for wine and water.  In his defense, his long absences were clearly because he was working multiple large tables including a party of 12 next to us.  That said, no one from management once came over to pick up the slack. The celebrity chef/owner of Piperade was doing his rounds around the restaurant, saying hello to patrons and kissing regular guests on the cheek.... perhaps he and his staff should have picked up the slack and covered for frazzled waiters instead of doing his celebrity round.

The icing on the cake was when our bill came with 18% "suggested" gratuity included.  One of my biggest gripes about our dining culture is this pervasive need to over tip and for entitled wait staff to expect 20% or more in tips for lackluster and sometimes downright bad service.  Tips should be considered a gift for good service, not expected for a terrible one.  Our hosts stayed back after the rest of us left to have a talk with our clueless waiter about his misguided expectations.  I wonder how that transpired.

In any case, back to what i said in the beginning.... the food was excellent and all things equal, I'd go back in a heart beat.  Sadly, the terrible service from last night's dinner shocked the entire group and unfortunately, terrible service overshadows good food.  In a city with a plethora of great dining venues, what sets restaurants apart is service.  In that aspect, Piperade fails miserably.  I don't envision going back anytime soon.
author: Vikram S.

description:
This place is amazing. 

I went with good friends for lunch and loved the decor. 

The Stepford wives having their lunch meeting next to us cracked me up. Don't worry - I didn't ding Piperade for that though.

What REALLY impressed me was that the chef (Gerald Hirigoyen) came out and talked to us. He asked about our days and made real conversation. That said a lot to me. 

Just to have full disclosure - I had heard of this place before because a co-worker of mine used to work there, but I think the reason the chef came out to talk to us was because the table had Dslr cameras and he may have thought we were there to review his restaurant. 

This was my first time having Basque wine and i was very much blown away. 

I would definitely go back for a special occasion.
author: Carlos A.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for a while now , finally last night had a very nice dinner there. 

We started with warm sheep's milk cheese platter , this was phenomenal my favorite dish of the night . We also got foie gras , not great. I could tell that it wasn't a high quality one . I'd skip it If i were you. Garlic soup was delicious . 

For our main courses we ordered , rack of lamb and duck filet both cooked to perfection . 

Overall a pleasant experience, I felt that service could have been more friendly . We also had to wait 35 min with reservations to be seated , but definitely returning to explore their menu and wine list further .
author: Mrs. Bauman M.

description:
Went there for dinner last night and it was fantastic.  The Lobster was delicious(my companion mopped up every bit of the sauce with bread).  The Duck Confit was also very good with great flavor.  We were supposed to share, she kind of hogged more of the Duck Confit than me.  Anyway, next time I am dining alone here :-)

Sweetbread on Monday was OK.  Not the best I ever had.  Would recommend you skip it, even if you are into that kind of thing:-)
author: Jim J.

description: My favorite restaurant in SF. The food is delicious and very authentic of the basque culture, from apetizers, entrees to desserts. It's a little pricey but it's worth it.
author: Emilie A.

description:
I never knew your names, but could recognize your smiles from an alley away. Even on the roughest of days, I could always count on you two having an upbeat comment. The line was long but you always kept it moving, having the rare talent to keep things moving efficiently without rushing anyone, sharing those momentary connections, without being pushy or intrusive. 

Today's my last day in the area, because I'm taking an awesome job elsewhere. When I left, I found a note scrawled on the top of my sandwich box: "Don't let your dreams be dreams". 

Thank you both for being so incredibly good at what you do, and always giving me a brief dose of real human connection over my lunch break. I'm amazed no one's stolen you away for a different client-facing role yet, or that you haven't started your own cute little bakery or shop. If you ever do, let me know, and I'll come by to visit again. 

Oh, and the food's pretty good too.
author: Preston P.

description:
A great place.  I love that the location is a bit out of the way which means that it's one of the few nice restaurants in SF where you can reliably find parking most evenings.
It has an upscale and elegant feel - lovely, large interior, gorgeous exposed brick walls, white table cloths, tables spaced well apart so you don't feel like you're on top of the people next to you.  
The food was delicious - the spring vegetable salad and piquillo pepper were terrific starters and the halibut entree was a real winner!  The wine list was nice, lots of California and Spanish bottles and a good selection of wines by the glass.  The service was very good and the hostess was especially gracious.  It's great to have another go-to restaurant for special occasions that's not pretentious.
It IS pricey, though.  Entrees around $15, mains around $30, glasses of wine around $15.  
We've been here several times before and will definitely return.
author: Maggie L.

description: Also came here on a Travelzoo deal.  It was an incentive for us to visit a restaurant in a neighborhood we rarely visit.  Really enjoyed the food and the service was better than most.  We weren't bothered by the predetermined tip on the bill because 1) the service was very good and 2) perhaps some customers may have tipped based on the TZ reduced bill.  What was odd on the bill was the "TZ deal tax" line item charge which was then taxed again.  But overall, loved the lamb and stuffed peppers and would return in the future.
author: David L.

description:
My co-workers call this place "that little window around the corner." It's true, this place has hardly a whisper of signage or logoed bags to indicate it's blue-blooded Piperade lineage.

You'd probably assume this place is some crappy Williams Sonoma subsidized cafeteria, WRONG!

Best damn Cobb salad I've ever had! And it's pre-packaged! Believe. More toppings than greens. Quality bacon and amazingly fresh hard boiled eggs (it matters!). 

I know what I'm having for lunch!
author: Lauren H.

description:
Last week for my birthday, my dad spoiled me and 10 others with dinner here. We were seated around a circular table in the center of the restaurant underneath a stunning chandelier made of green wine bottles and Christmas lights. I really loved the cozy ambiance of the place.

The wines (one red, one white) that we selected to pair with our dinner were fantastic, as was the cocktail I ordered with gin, madeira wine, and lemon I believe. 

To start, I had bites of the mushroom tartlet, piquillo peppers, garlic soup, and dungeness crab. I'd order them all again if afforded the chance to return. For dinner, I had the sole - which to be honest, didn't have a hell of a lot of flavor - and sampled my dad's shellfish stew.. excellent. As for dessert, I tried the apple tart (yum!) and orange blossom beignets. 

Overall, I couldn't have asked for a better experience to send me into my late-twenties. Thanks Jackie T. for the recommendation.
author: Tina A.

description:
Hey Sunshine!

That's the greeting I've gotten the times I've gone to the Piperade counter. Who doesn't love a smile and friendly service?

Get here earlier for a better selection. I've gotten the tuna melt and chips which are about $9 total. The tuna melt comes with a side salad with a light vinagarette and both are really yummy and filling for lunch.  When it was slim pickings I got the roast beef sandwich which I didn't care for too much. The bread was too hard and the mustard was a bit overwhelming.

I've had their  coconut and pistacchio macaroons and boy were they delicious. They were freshly made, light and a perfect ending to my meal.

I def recommend this place if you're by the area.
author: Roxanne R.

description: My husband and I are newlyweds and recently had our rehearsal dinner at Piperade and it was perfect. I mean, flawless. Every part of - the food was exquisite, the servers were so attentive and professional, and the private dining room is just gorgeous. We were so thrilled with the entire experience!! We're very much foodies and so are our families so it was very important to us to find a restaurant that would meet expectations, and Piperade just blew everyone away - we're still getting rave reviews from that night. You can't go wrong here.
author: Jamie C.

description:
I dined here last night with 5 other people, at the suggestion of one of the couples in our party. They had been here twice before, and raved about it. I've known about Piperade for quite some time but had never dined there. I was looking forward to trying it out!

Unfortunately, since last night was the Chinese New Year's Parade, all of us were running way behind for our reservation. I called the restaurant and the person on the phone was very nice and understanding and told me not to worry about it - it had been a theme all night and everything was running behind. We finally all made it and after ordering drinks at the bar we were seated a short time later. Our server, who was on the older side and possibly European (?), came by pretty quickly and announced the specials. My boyfriend and I wanted to order a bottle of wine, and I instructed my boyfriend to inquire about a bottle in the $40-50 price range. the wine list is pretty extensive, so we were hoping the server would make things easier on us by offering a few suggestions. He immediately said "the Rioja is very good" so I flipped over to that page and saw that both the ones he suggested were either $60 or $70. If I were in charge I would have kept looking for something in our price range, but my boyfriend is more impulsive. He asked our server "which one is better??" and what do you think the server said? "oh, the $70 one!" That REALLY irritated me. I wasn't the one paying for dinner, so I let it go. Also, when the server was going around taking our orders, I said I would be ordering a few small plates and not an entree. My boyfriend had to tell our server 2-3 times that he was NOT ordering an entree.

Anyway, our food was very good, a bit pricey at least for my small plates, but it arrived pretty quickly. Our server was not the most attentive, I'm not even sure he ever came by to check on us and ask how we were doing. We ordered dessert, and then the bill came. I wasn't involved in the bill paying process, but we paid with one credit card and the rest cash. When server guy came to collect the receipt, he opened up the folder, looked at it for a minute, then walked over to a nearby vacant table and looked at it some more. We all kind of looked at each other like "WTF?" He returned and commented that our tip was really low considering the amount of our check. I took a look at the bill and realized that my friend had tipped on the amount HE paid with credit card, not the total bill. His mistake, and we corrected it.  It was most definitely an uncomfortable moment, and I honestly don't know what I would do if I were in his position, but he definitely had major attitude with us! 

In summary, I thought the food was very good, the appetizers were a bit on the pricey side (two apps equal the cost of an entree), the ambiance was very nice, and I'm still really irritated at the server upselling us on a more expensive bottle of wine than we wanted to pay for. Oh! I almost forgot - he didn't even ASK who all was having wine, he just started pouring glasses! Two members of our party were drinking something else, and one doesn't drink at ALL! Grrrrr. Not sure if I'll be in a rush to come back here.
author: Dina M.

description:
Probably one of the best meals I ever ate. 
Appetizers, main course, dessert were superb. Service was not overly attentive which was good
author: Ewan F.

description:
This place is delicious! I don't know how I stumbled upon it, but I decided to take my husband here for his birthday. Neither of us had Basque cuisine so we thought it would be fun to try. The awesome yelp reviews sealed to deal to try it. 

You know, how you try a new place and you love some things, are ok with others and dislike a few - NOT this place. Everything from the bread to dessert was awesome!  I haven't felt that way about a restaurant in a while. 

We started with the mushroom tartlet and the dungeness crab salad. I could have sat the and had 2 more servings of each of these. But for then came the entrees- My husband had the lamb, which was cooked perfectly. And I had the seafood stew. 

For dessert we had some kind of chocolate hazelnut ganache cake. And let the servers make recs here - you won't go wrong.

Only knock on the place is its way in the FiDi. Its full of suits, which is a different scene than I'm used to relative to the Valencia corridor. But other than being the youngest people in the restaurant - everything else was great and memorable
author: Komal B.

description: It is amazing how an aloof waiter can really ding a celebratory dinner between 2 special friends. Sadly the delicious food and beautiful setting aren't enough to make me want to go back and sit through the less than luke warm service we received from our waiter tonight.
author: Billy P.

description:
While the service is VERY, VERY friendly, their service is VERY, VERY slow... painfully, even with a short line. 

Bring your own coffee cup for a $1 refill, and you get to by-pass the line. 

I especially like their soups, but they are like twice as much as Levi's. However, the way Levi's cafeteria is going these days, as in downhill, I might just suck it up, wait in line, and pay the extra couple of bucks.

Cash unless you spend $5 or more.
author: Emily B.

description: Fabulous. Entertaining friends from out of town. Food, ambiance, service...just beautiful. Spent a good portion of my career working with top shelf chefs and service in this business. Perfect. Thank you.
author: Justine W.

description: This place is a bit overrated. It's an OK place for lunch but food is not consistent. Turkey and Brie sandwich is quite good; Cobb salad ok, same with the curry chicken salad. I'm guessing the curry chicken salad isn't one if their more popular items because when I opened the to-go box the lettuce was tinged red (you know how lettuce looks when it starts getting old). Very unappetizing. I won't go back here unless I'm in the area and nothing else is open.
author: K F.

description:
This is a cozy restaurant, with a warm ambiance, which is great when seeking Basque food.  Although the food is Basque, it would be enjoyed by anybody as the meals are pretty mainstream and there are no off the wall dishes on the menu.  The Piperade itself was amazing, and probably my favorite dish of the evening.

I would have given this place 5 stars, but the service was a disaster.  The host (Igor) is actually the most pleasant person there and he is from Basque country.  Igor is a delight.  If he was our waiter, I would have nothing to complain about!  Our server (Javier or John) was a total jerk.  He cut us off numerous times telling us what NOT to order.  That was helpful the first time with the wine list (many were from Spain), annoying the second, third and fourth times.  When we asked him about the Piperade he replied that he would recommend something else and stated (paraphrased): "It is not that great.  It is traditional Basque, if you like that sort of thing."  Why do you think we are here buddy?  I wondered why he is even working there if he isn't stoked on the place.

The food was outstanding.  The garlic soup and ham & cheese tourine were delicious.  We also split the Piperade and rock fish -- both quite tasty.  The Piperade was my favorite on the menu and my mouth is watering right now just thinking about it!

I will definitely be returning on my next visit to the city.  I will just hope for a different waiter next time!
author: Emily R.

description: This is my second visit to Piperade. They outdid themselves. All dishes were very delicious. halibut dish was simply out of the world! Sheer gastronomic pleasure!
author: Kiran P.

description:
The boyfriend and I recently came here for our monthly "Double Date Night" with our friends.  We made reservations for 8:30 and didn't get seated until past 9 pm.  I was pretty hangry by then, but as we were with friends I tried to remain cheerful.

We ordered a bunch of food: beef crudo, mushroom tartlet, dungeness crab with mango, piqullo chilies, roasted cauliflower soup, cornish hen, piperade, and the Friday special black cod, and for dessert we had the meyer lemon roll.

I loved the mushroom tartlet and the cauliflower soup and wasn't that impressed by anything else.  Oh wait, the meyer lemon roll was actually pretty tasty, I wasn't really expecting much by the time we got there, but it was definitely delicious.

My biggest complaint was the service.  I sat for more than half of dinner without any water.  Seriously?  The waiter walked by multiple times and saw my empty water glass and did nothing.  Additionally, a few times he came and filled everyone else's water glass but mine.  Really?  REALLY?!?!

Not ok.  I don't think I want to come back here, for the money I'm paying I feel like I should at least get some water and not have to ask multiple times for a refill.  I understand that things are a lot more laid back in Europe.  I get it, I enjoyed that we got to take some time and enjoy ourselves without being rushed, but I just hated asking for water every time.  And I wasn't that impressed with the food.  I'm hoping that March's date night will turn out better than this.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: Tried this place on Sat and the food was amazing. The restaurant was packed so it took them 30 min to seat us even though we had a reservation. We tried their NY steak which was very tasty.
author: Damoon M.

description: Food very good to excellent, except desserts, which is strange, since the owner was a former pastry chief.  Our waiter was either a depressed autistic or a robot, although that might be offensive to robots.  Hal was way more engaging. Our waiter had a hard time smiling, and talking was not in his repertoire, like saying hello or what would you like.  Consequently our dinner was drawn out over the night, with the table next to us, which came in after us, getting their dinner first - tock an hour after ordering to get the meal.
author: Jeanette M.

description:
Wonderful gourmet Basque food. I asked the waitress for recommendations for the most authentic Basque food and she steered me towards the calamari and the Piperade with serrano ham and egg. Both had wonderful fresh and vibrant flavors. The ingredients were wonderful and everything seemed carefully prepared.
I eat sheepherder food at Basque restaurants with family-style seating all the time. It was a treat to try gourmet Basque cuisine for once.
author: Steve T.

description:
Came here for my birthday on Thursday and had a wonderful experience.

Atmosphere is top notch. We were greeted by an incredibly congenial staff and the setting is very warm and intimate with its low exposed ceilings and brick walls. 

Now for the food...

Had the chicory salad and mussels with frisee'. YUM. Chicory salad was a nice and pleasant intro to our entrees, but nothing out of this world. The Mussels and frisee on the other hand, MM! Perfect bites of mussels, with frisee, with tiny crunchy croutons and parsley...so good. 

For our entrees I had the steelhead and oh my god...Out comes this beautiful hunk of fish topped with a foam and bedded over a beautiful melange of vegetables and...dare i say it...BACON. Of course bonus points go to any chef who incorporates bacon into a dish, but boy was this was special. Each bite was just a perfect bit of smokey, buttery deliciousness. My sister ate the lamp chops with parsnip and sausage and that was also fantastic. The lamb literally melts in your mouth...Mom had the duck confit, also stellar. Probably some of the best duck I've ever had. 

Desserts: Chocolate cake and quince clafoutis. 
Warning about the chocolate cake, you will die and go straight to heaven. This is the most rich, moist chocolate cake I've EVER HAD. And let's just say I eat a lot of chocolate cake, ok? The quince clafoutis is for people who want to finish dinner lightly, and not feeling like a stuffed turkey. It was really yummy, and I've never had quince as part of a dessert like that, so it was a welcomed change. 

Overall, GO TO PIPERADE. You will not regret it!!
author: Jackie D.

description:
Came here on a Thurs night and there was plenty of street parking at 630p. It was hell getting through the freeway entrance traffic though. Restaurant is cozy with a rustic/industrial feel to it. Loved how intimate it felt, but there were a few large (and loud) groups in the restaurant. My girlfriend and I sat in a quieter area of the restaurant after we asked to move. 

Our waiter was kinda blah. Not much personality and not warm and friendly at all. Kinda of brusk and no nonsense type. Minus 1 star for that. 

Ok, food was very good! We ordered the Garlic Soup and Calamari appetizers - both were very good! The soup reminded us of homemade, tummy warming broth that you'd find in someone's kitchen. Calamari was nicely prepared as well, not over or under cooked.

I had the duck and my girlfriend had the steak. I really liked my duck and I noticed the portions there were pretty generous for a somewhat "fancy" place. My girlfriend really liked her steak seeing as that she ate the entire thing.

The dessert was a chocolate cake, but I found it too rich and heavy.

Overall, would recommend this restaurant, especially on a nice night where you can sit outside on their cute patio!
author: Freckles H.

description:
You know you're going to have a good dining experience when the first person you meet upon entering a restaurant is the head chef/owner who greets you and seats you at your table.  

My time at Piperade got off to a great start, . . . and while the service after being initially seated was lackluster, the food was quite good.

My meal began with the grande beans with bacalao, caviar, creme fraiche, and sherry vinegar.  The beans were perfectly tender and the fish was succulent.  The creme fraiche mixed with the sherry vinegar gave the dish a wonderful creamy/tangy taste.  The caviar, while tasty on its own, added too much salt to the dish and threw off its balance.

For my entree, I ordered the tuna Sandwich with roasted peppers, mixed greens, and onion marmalade.  Truthfully, the tuna sandwich was one of the best I've ever had.  The fish was seared perfectly and had a wonderful flavor when combined with the other ingredients. 

For dessert I tried the orange blossom beignets.  The orange flavor was slight yet clearly present and the beignets themselves were extremely light and moist.
author: Oski B.

description: The location of the restaurant is great, just a block off the Embarcadero, a beautiful, bustling, waterfront walkway, popular for locals and tourists. Upon arrival, we were warmly welcomed by the receptionist and she led us right to our reserved table. The atmosphere was cozy and warm but still upscale. We ordered a bottle of wine that was promptly served and they consistently kept our glasses full throughout the meal. We loved that we didn't have to worry about any exclusions on the menu so that we could freely explore the options. We opted to go for more of a family style experience, halving each dish so we could try each other's. For appetizers, we ordered the strip steak crudo with serrano chile pepper, Granny Smith apples and fingerling potato chips; and the frisee salad with warm serrano vinaigrette, goat cheese-stuffed piquillo peppers and pine nuts - EXQUISITE. The steak crudo was sliced perfectly and the blend of the textures was extremely well done. The salad was also great as a light starter with flavorful ingredients. The meal was very well coursed as we had a small break after finishing our appetizers before our entrees arrived. We ordered the roasted rack of lamb with merguez, fennel, roasted bread, pecan, cumin and date relish; and the braised pork cheeks with tempranillo, black plums, Cipollini onions and parsnips. We were most attracted to these dishes because of the unique blending of ingredients and we were absolutely not disappointed. The pork cheeks legitimately MELTED in our mouths, paired perfectly with the thick sauce and onions. The lamb had incredible flavor and went extremely well with the date relish. We took a small pause again before ramping up for our dessert course: almond turron mousse with candied almonds, and caramel custard "Koka" (aka flan). Once again, we were very impressed, both being just sweet enough with great flavor and texture. Overall, our experience was very memorable with amazing cuisine, great service and a cozy atmosphere. I'll definitely be back!
author: Amanda R.

description:
Came here for the first time on Friday now...WHOA..it was so good!!
The Dungeness crab salad was a perfect start to our mouth watering delicious meal. 
I didn't have check out the wine list but the Pinot my date selected was amazing...
I also enjoyed the service and the ambiance..it's a place good for a romantic dinner as well as a dinner party...It is on my list to revisit soon...
author: Mimi T.

description:
The cozy space makes you feel at home right away! 

Came here for a department holiday party at work, as did several other departments from our company.  The small space and big tables made it a pretty good place for groups.  Service was pretty good considering how many people there were and food arrived on time.

Calarmari - According to my group, this was very good.  I'm more of a fried calamari fan so I can't comment.

Mussels appetizer - This was pretty good.  I was expecting mussels in sauce or soup, so I was surprised to see mussels out of the shell mixed into a salad.  Nevertheless it was done perfectly and was very tasty.

Seared tuna salad with potato, eggs, and green beans - was really really good!  The tuna was so perfect that it just melted in my mouht!  It sat over a bed of salad mixed with fresh herbs.  It was a very clean taste.  It's not something that will fill you up but had very good flavor.
author: Erica D.

description:
Excellent food.  Great and interesting wine list.  Lovely ambience (and fairly quiet).  Good service.

Recommended: the crab thing, stuffed peppers, asparagus salad (wow! good), basque fish stew, and of course piperade.  Also the Gateau Basque.

Very pricey.  I think we paid $80/person.

Given that there's already 446 reviews, I'll stop there.
author: Josh B.

description:
I've driven by this place, dozens and dozens of time.  Behind a quietly unassuming storefront is a tasty experience and a nice dinner out...IF you're not vegetarian.

We arrived about 30 minutes early for our reservation and sat at the bar for a bit.  They have a very good selection of wines and even more of tasty brown liquids :-)  Though packed, bar service was only a little slow - well done.

The restaurant itself was pretty full and our reservation time came and passed.  The hostess kept telling us "almost" and "just a few more minutes" but no table materialized.  After a quiet word to the manager we were finally seated in a corner table by the window - cozy and quiet, nice since the space does get a bit loud when full.

The food itself was judged excellent by my dining companions with high regard for the lamb and chicken dishes as well the appetizers.  Unfortunately the vegetarian options were quite limited.  Though tasty, I wouldn't sing the praises of any of my meal.  The desserts, on the other hand? TASTY, like OMG tasty.  I nearly inhaled the Basque Gateau with cherry preserves and the chocolate cake was equally tasty.

The service is where the 3 star rating became a 4.  Our waiter was more neighborly and attentive than friendly - we liked him, it felt more intimate.  To apologize for our seating delay, the manager comped us both our desserts and also gave us some tasty dessert wine.  Classy but more so because our waiter brought over the wine and dessert and said, "on us and thank you so much for dining with us".  No fuss, just genuine feeling.

Bottom line - Go for the meat dishes and dessert.  Vegetarians note that you won't have too many choices but you also won't go hungry.
author: Gautam S.

description:
This restaurant does not care at all about their customers. Do not support them.

My friend booked his 60th birthday celebrations at Piperade over 6 months ago. Less than 3 weeks before the dinner, he called to be sure all the reservations were in place for his December event. They informed him that they had cancelled his reservation to accommodate a corporate event instead. They hadn't bothered to notify him. 

I flew in from Canada for this event. Others have come from across the States and the local area. Piperade suggested he switch his event from Saturday to the Monday when they were open again...hardly helpful as most of us will have flown home by then. Obviously, our friend had to scramble on his own to find a last minute replacement. His precise plans for this incredible life milestone have been ruined. 

Piperade...you need to respect your customers' reservations or don't bother at all booking events. Will never step in your restaurant again.
author: Mattthew C.

description: I've been to this restaurant about three times now and it's a frickin' snoozefest in there! The servers, bussers, and expediters were all cold and mechanical and could care less if you were enjoying your experience or the food. For instance, I had the rack of lamb for my entree this past visit. It came out cold and way underdone so I had a few bites and left the rest on my plate because it was unappetizing. The plate was eventually removed from the table as if everybody orders a $32 dish just to eat two bites. Nobody asked me how it was or if I was enjoying it. They don't care if you like the food and apparently they don't care if the food is properly prepared in the first place. Once our dinner order was placed in the beginning, we no longer existed and the staff was just going through the motions. They just want to get you in and get you out! I'm actually really surprised that this restaurant is as popular as it is given my recent experiences here.
author: Vicente G.

description:
I am having a little moment here.  100 reviews.  I have wondered what I would review on my hundredth, alas while the restaurant wasn't 5 stars, the occasion was.  My husband and I celebrated our two year anniversary last night!!!!  Well, officially 12 years together, but two of those years we were legally wed.  So yay for us!

Anyhoo, Piperade.

Piperade is consistently interesting.  Unless you have been here 10 times and order the same thing every time, you will be sure to explore new regions of your palate.  

The bacaloa (salted cod) was excellent.  Presented as a thin falayed layer of sushi grade fish topped with a backbone of shucked gooey oysters and drizzled lemon crème fraiche, I was in heaven, but the man wasn't really having it.  As he pulled a face, his words were "I just ate the ocean."

I let him finish the haricot vert salad while I OGed over the bacaloa.  The salad was extraordinary (in the literal sense) as they used herbs I had never seen paired with green beans.  For example, the chef added mint to the otherwise earthy flavor that was such a nice surprise and worked cleanly with the walnuts.  It was subtle and clean. Save some bread to mop up the morsels left over after the green beans are gone; they are not to be wasted.

I took fellow yelper's suggestions to forgo the big plates and stick to the small dishes and I am glad I did.  Therefore the calamari came next, which was not like any calamari I have ever had... Again the Piperade surprise.  As far as I could tell, the calamari was only cooked in the sauce.  There was no crunch because there was no breading, no deep frying or pan frying.  This was calamari you would find in a sushi restaurant; fresh and chewy.  The sauce was fantastic, but very different...spicy with fennel and coriander and salty with capers... It was really flavorful but didn't take away from the calamari.  I enjoyed the dish but was left wanting a more substantial consistency to the calamari.

And then my favorite: the peppers stuffed with goat cheese.  God I love this dish.  If you love a really fresh goat cheese, please do yourself a favor and order this.  Perfectly softened piquillo peppers, ballooning with barely warmed goat cheese and topped with pine nuts and golden raisins. YUM.  It is just such a beautiful combination and one that I can't wait to emulate at home.   

I had forewarned the man to stick with the small plates, but the steak was calling to him. I didn't taste it as I am not eating meat these days, but the consensus was that it was "ok" and "not $30 good."  Also, he did not finish it! 12 years together and this has only happened a handful of times.

But all was good as we ended the meal with the cornbread and fruit dessert which was just perfect.  We both loved it.

Yes, newness is relative, but to me Piperade felt novel.  If you have an open mind and an adventurous palate, Piperade is worth the money.
author: Hayley W.

description: We love Piperade.  Though we live in San Jose, we make sure to come up to the city to eat at Piperade at least twice a year.  The ambience is perfect: energetic but not too noisy to prohibit private conversations.  The service is excellent (we so appreciate Miriam), and we have  many favorites on the menu: the little gem salad, the seafood stew, the roasted rack of lamb, the warm apple tart, etc.  Usually, we get the Dungeness crab "Txangurro" for an appetizer, but it was missing from menu last night.  Piperade might, in fact, be our favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  The owner/chef always stops by our table to check that everything is all right.  That's the kind of care that goes into the entire eating experience at this lovely Basque restaurant.
author: Kris M.

description:
Loved loved Piperade.  I met the chef at a wine tasting at La Mar and have been meaning to go there forever.  My friends took me there for my birthday and we had an absolute blast.  

We shared the appetizers and they were all amazing and so were our entrees.   The food was fantastic.  Our waiter was a bit stiff in the beginning but we ended up having a great experience with him.

I can't wait to come back!
author: Ayelet B.

description:
I really hope this was just an off-night for Piperade; otherwise, I would think you fellow Yelpers giving the high marks here are on crack! Come on.. raw chicken?

We came here by default because it was the only place that could accommodate a party of 6 on short notice on a Saturday night.  We had 2 appetizers: the cold mussels with bread salad was okay, but the "bread" was just straight up CROUTONS. The open mushroom pie though, was AMAZING. This was the best piece of food of the entire night.

The entrees were nothing but disappointment. I ordered the lamb. It was decent, but the rack I had at Chouchou less than a month ago was way better. Also, it was way more overcooked than the medium rare that I had ordered. In fact, I'm sure the lamb that went to the other person at our table was medium rare when she had ordered medium. Umm.. when the waiter brought the food, didn't I ask, "Is this the medium rare?" As for the other entrees.. well.. I have nothing good to say. The sea bass was very overcooked and bland. The sauce/toppings that came with the chicken was good, but one of the chickens at our table was so undercooked that it was raw in the center. Shouldn't a chef know how long to cook a chicken breast? And the pommes frites we got on the side were simply store-bought frozen fries. Yea... totally not worth it.

Service was not good, either. My water glass was empty for most of the meal and no one came back to check on us, even when my friend was waiting for someone to come by to take back the raw chicken. Horrible.

I guess we weren't the only ones who were dissatisfied, because the couple at the table next to us just walked out of the restaurant since their food never came out.

Nope, not going back there again.
author: Kazu O.

description:
A friend booked this restaurant months ago for his 60th birthday party. Three weeks before our dinner, Piperade called to say a corporation had bought out the restaurant and our reservation would not be honored. Although they offered to help find a new place and buy a dinner for two, it just seemed like the little guy was squeezed out in favor of a better deal and more money. Truly disappointing. Has the tech industry struck again?

We had people coming from Connecticut and Canada for this event and the word has been spread. Stay away from Piperade, they don't honor their word.
author: Rich S.

description: I swoon over their mandarin chicken salad. Definitely worth the wait!
author: amanda k.

description: I wandered upon this restaurant walking from the Ferry Building. I started with the stuffed pepper and calamari. Both were fantastic. The sauce on the squid was so good you wanted to sop up every bit with bread. The pepper was full of goat cheese and sweet raisins. To die for! Presentation was appetizing. The strip steak, was like a carpaccio, and was the only thing that I think could have been improved. I drizzled olive oil over the top and that helped give it flavor. It was just a little strange with apples, peppers and potato chips atop the meat. I would sub out the chips with some manchego. The gateau for dessert was very delicious, as well. Not too sweet and the sour kumquat on top was divine! Service was good. Restaurant was beautiful. Overall, I would go out of my way to come here again and keep trying new things on the menu. There were so many that sounded great!
author: Yvonne A.

description:
This is one of a handful of the great restaurants in the city--food is consistent and ambiance is nice but not over-crowded, ostentatious, or glitzy.

Great food and great wine.
author: Zack M.

description:
Wow.
Two out of two steak eaters at my table may have uttered the words "I think this is the best steak I've ever had."  One of those steak eaters has eaten at so many steak houses around the country it's not funny.
The lamb was equally to die for - we couldn't pick a favorite.  Every time you took a bite of one and thought, "it doesn't get any better than this," you'd be offered a bite of the other and think, "hang on. . . . "
We scored an amazing deal through travelzoo - two appetizers, two entrees, two desserts, and two glasses of cava.  It was perfection.
Both appetizers blew us away (again with the "no way yours is better than mine, try it. . . "), the cava was great, as was the glass of Basque red I ordered (it went so well with both meats - yum).  The desserts were pretty good, but I was already full and on Meat Cloud 9.
Service was good, food came out quickly (though we were there pretty early on in the night), and the space is lovely.  I'm definitely a fan.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I've never been to a Basque restaurant before but i sure want to keep going now! This restaurant definitely isn't pretentious. Good quiet atmosphere but with good conversation going on all around, though I think my friend & I were the youngest people in the restaurant.

We came early & sat at the bar to enjoy some vino & cheese. Ordered a bottle of pinot noir & just sat enjoying the delish bread with our cheese. The bartender was good at knowing when to pour more wine into our glasses as well as knowing when to interrupt. I hate when servers interrupt during a good conversation, so I was glad that he knew when to interrupt & when to walk away.

As soon as we finished, I let the hostess know we were ready to take our seats (had reserved seating through opentable).

Dinner was... unbelievable! Their bread is so crunchy on the outside & soft & firm on the inside. We ate all the bread w/ that very olive-y olive oil dip! Loved! For entrees, my friend chose the Roasted Salmon & I picked the Duck breast per the waiter's recommendation. I was hesitant to try duck because it could go so right or more commonly.. so wrong. This duck.. did not disappoint! Ordered medium rare & pretty much licked the sauce off the plate! That sauce w/ that perfectly crispy skin & moist breast paired so perfectly! The salmon was just as good! I believe it was breaded in a tomato-y sauce, not that it tasted like tomato. But believe me.. must try! Btw thank you waiter (sry forgot his name)! 

Overall, good ambiance, good conversation & company, good food & good wine. What could be better? Dinner cost about $220 including tax & tip for the two of us... so come with an open wallet & an even bigger appetite!
author: Phuong H.

description:
Loved the garlic soup, loved the Serano Ham, loved the Foie Gras, adored  the Mushroom Tartlet, crazy about the Calamari and Red pepper filled with goat cheese. 

Overall, I'm crazy about this restaurant!

Will go back again for sure!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
I usually don't leave reviews on yelp, but tonight I just can't get over the mayonnaise!
We went to Piperade for dinner tonight and ordered the following: calamari and manchego appetizer followed by the rack of lamb and the halibut.
The calamari were very tasty, the cheese just plain boring and not as well aged as expected. The lamb was very good, but the portion was small ( 2 lambchops and 1 sausage). The halibut is the real reason why this is only a 2 star review. The fish was well cooked, nice and juicy, but absolutely plain (i had to ask for salt and pepper). The side of peas was good but then there was the mayonnaise. I'm still not sure what to make of this, but there was a spoonful of mayonaise smeared on the plate and dusted with paprika. Bland halibut with mayonnaise? (I'm not talking rouille with boullabaisse). Very dissapointing.
author: Daniela K.

description: We really like the idea of small plates. We each ordered 4 small things and were totally stuffed by the end. I wish there more vegetarian options, but I always think that. The manchego cheese was a little salty for my taste, and the hubby wasn't a fan of the chickpeas but everything else was delicious. The stuffed pepper was awesome!
author: jessica r.

description: This restaurant is a real treat!  The food is delicious-something different from the "usual" San Francisco dining experience.  Everything was delicious.  There were 4 of us and we all ordered different appetizers and entrees, so we basically had a "tasting" menu!  Can't wait to come back again.  And the service was wonderful, too.
author: John M.

description:
(+)
- Mr. Williams
- turkey brie and cranberry
- banh mi
- friendly employees

(-)
- sometimes a long line


This little to-go counter is kind of hidden in a little alleyway across from Williams and Sonoma office. The employees are super chill and friendly. There's only two manning the small counter so usually there is a little wait line wise and food wise.

Most of their sandwiches are 7-9 bucks and come with a little side salad which is not a bad deal considering everything I've had so far has been tasty.

My favorite has been the Mr.Williams sandwich, probably because it contains delicious fried chicken. I also really enjoy the bread they use because it's a little firmer than usual in a good way and gives the sandwich great texture. The turkey and brie make for a good flavor combo and uses the same yummy bread. Banh mi was just ok, not as good as the other two.

Will definitely be back, next up, curry salad!
author: Julia S.

description: For me, a restaurant with this qualtiy of ingredients and execution is the pinnacle.  I am not sophisticated enough to enjoy food that is better than this.  Unexpected MVP of the night: Warm Sheep's Milk Cheese + Ham Terrine, Aged Sherry. . .one of my dining companions ordered this.  Based on the name I would have skipped it.  Wasn't interested in a big old pile of sheep's milk.  Turns out this was one of the most sublime things I have ever tasted.  If you go to Piperade please order it.  Overall, the dining experience we had at Piperade was worth every penny and sits near the top of my 2013 culinary adventures.
author: Rob D.

description: Great food, excellent service--especially if you are lucky enough to have Miriam as your server.  Highly recommended.  The food is always fresh and the Gateau Basque is a wonderful dessert treat to end your meal.
author: Ace E.

description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere.  There's a reason I keep coming back here.  Oh, and did I mention the best duck confit I've ever had?  Give it a try!
author: Brad P.

description:
Wow.  We came tonight because of a "Bloomspot" promotion.  Despite going out several times a week, Piperade had evaded us.
We were so comfortable with the decor and seating.  The service was professional and efficient.  The food (lamb and halibut) was the best we have experienced in months.  We will be back soon.
author: David M.

description: Ate here on a trip to San Francisco, the food was ok , wine was great but service left so much to be desired .  I feel like when you are paying good money for a meal you should be treated nicely and not with a cold shoulder.  If I were eating at Applebee's I wouldn't mind but when I pay over $200 for a meal a bit of politeness might be nice! It makes me mad that I wasted a night of my trip on a mediocre meal here when there are so many better places to eat in the Bay Area. Not only that but , after dinner there is no taxis to be found nearby!
author: Michelle A.

description:
Piperade was AMAZING!

I came here for a friend's bday dinner and over all the food was really good. 

For the appetizers we had the calamari and some mushroom pie dish (sorry, I'm not good with names). The mushroom appetizer was so delicious. The mix between the flaky crust on the bottom and combination of the mushrooms on top were great with each bite. The calamari was good as well. Not your typical fried calamari. It was more of a marinated calamari, but the flavors were really good and had a nice kick to each bite as well. 

For my entree, I had the cornish hen. The dish was pretty damn good. The hen was cooked perfectly and it had some vegetables in the mix of the dish. It wasn't overcooked or nothing and it had great flavor. 

This is a great place to go to. A little bit on the expensive side but it's a nice place to dine at. The ambiance is really nice too. The service was great too. Our waiter was attentive and kind.  Just be aware of the neighborhood. While it's in a nice location of the city, my car got broken into just a few steps away from the restaurant. I guess that's the city for you no matter where you are. 

Enjoy.
author: Nadia C.

description:
The food here is solid.  They have nicely-prepared seafood.  Squid with pineapple was a nice starter. Seafood stew was very tasty.  The blackened cod was OK.  Chocolate hazel nut mousse was a nice finish. 

I would have normally given this place 4 stars, but knocked it down to a 2 because of problems with the service.  The wait staff is "old school" and have no patience to explain the menu - would rather just hurry up and take your order.  This really destroys the experience, expecially on a menu like this where some explanation would be helpful.  But that wasn't the worst of it.  My waiter did not return my credit card with the receipt (and I didn't notice) - and even though they had my cell phone number from the reservation, no one bothered to call me for an hour to tell me they still had my card.  By then I was long gone.  Aghrrr!
author: Larry P.

description:
yummy soups and sandwiches, awesome friendly staff. 
Lines can be long, prices aren't cheap - but it's all fresh made, quality ingredients. You can't really compare this to Safeway; Piperade is a good restaurant and this is basically a to-go window for it.
author: Charlie H.

description:
Physically, a beautiful restaurant.  We went with guests from Chicago.  Everything was very good, but not great.  For appetizers, we ordered the tomato tartlet, calamari and Piquillo peppers.  All were very good.  For entrees, we ordered the veal stew (excellent), steamed rockfish (only ok) and shellfish stew (ok, nothing great).  We passed on the dessert.  

We went on a Saturday night and the restaurant was under staffed.  Our poor waitress was running around serving a pretty large group and she had to bus her own tables (well, ours for sure).  As such, things were a bit slow.  The veggies we ordered did not come out until we were almost done with our meal.
author: Rachel M.

description: Good food, service, and ambiance overall.  Food is true to the region.
author: Evan T.

description:
The food at Piperade was absolutely amazing, and I would have gladly given it a 5 star rating if it were not for the incredibly disappointing service.

The tomato tarlet was out of this world and the piquillo peppers stuffed with goat cheese were delicious!  I also loved my entree, the steamed rockfish served on a bed of spinach with a garlic vinaigrette - the dish was light, flavorful, and healthy enough to be guilt-free! :)

The service at Piperade, on the other hand, was quite disappointing.  First, the hostess forgot to provide the wine list along with the menus.  Then, the waitress took forever to come by and ask for drink orders.  Then, after our meals were cleared away, there was again a very long wait before we were even offered dessert menus.  When the dessert menus finally did come, we were told that the restaurant was out of multiple desserts, including the orange blossom beignets I had heard so much about and had been wanting to try.  And, finally, to top off an evening of poor service, the waitress forgot to include the slip requiring my signature after she ran my credit card, so we had to flag her down and request it.  Unbelieve, huh?  It was a real shame that a place with such wonderful food and great ambience failed on the service front.
author: Barnali D.

description: Consistently superb food; friendly and professional service; warm and comfortable venue. Prices are not unreasonable. Some interesting wines.
author: Dan R.

description:
The food gets 4 stars, but I am docking a star for poor service.  

For a restaurant that is smack dab in the Financial District, you would think they would understand the importance of prompt service.   Most lunchtime diners are on their breaks and can't afford to spend precious time twiddling their thumbs waiting for the basics to be performed (orders taken, drinks served, checks dropped).  

That said, the Butter Lettuce + Fresh Herb Salad is so very simple, yet so very delicious.  The Cold Poached Foie Gras and Terrine of Sheep's Milk + Ham are worth every artery-clogging calorie.  Top it off w/ the Warm Apple Tart + Caramel Sauce (which has a great smoky flavor) and you have yourself a proper end to a stressful workweek.
author: Michelle H.

description: Really delicious food! Had the gascon mixed drink, stuffed pequillo peppers, butternut squash soup, black bass on leeks and potatoes and dessert.  All of it was tasty and pretty light.  A perfect lunch.
author: Nancy L.

description: Date night led us here for our dinner before we headed on over to the Exploratorium. I had the Oven Roasted Pork Tenderloin, Green Lentils, Kumquats Confit and my BF had the Slow Braised Veal Cheeks with Peppers. Our meals were quite tasty and the service was great. We did wish that we could have stayed a bit longer to enjoy everything but we had to get our Orange Blossom Beignets to go and they were light, fluffy, and so tasty.
author: Shauna S.

description:
This is one of my most favorite restaurants in SF! Everything is always perfect! 

The staff ~ exceptional! Outstanding drinks/bar service. Wonderful menu with professional waiters. Cuisine is outstanding and well worth the price.  The desserts are SO good! I crave the orange beignets and dream about them~ please try them! They are the best I have found.  

The atmosphere is lovely and romantic. 

All the appetizers and desserts are wonderful! If you can fit in a main course, order one of the specials that the waiter describes! Always so fresh and plated beautifully. Delicious choices on their menu; all quite delightful.
author: Jennifer J S.

description: I went back to Piperade and the food did not live up to the 5 star rating I gave after my initial visit.  I must admit that I took a trip to the Basque region in between the visits, but even felt embarrassed after hyping up the restaurants to my friends who were all a bit disappointed with the food.
author: Yusef F.

description:
This place has a french fusion menu, so don't be fooled if you are really going for Vasque/Spanish food, it is good food though...

The music they played destroyed the charm of the place, it made me feel as if I was in a Taqueria in the mission... 

 AWFUL service and WATCH OUT these guys are tricksters, they charged me $600 out of thin air, my check was $65, not only did they swiped my card twice and charged it for $95, plus a magic $405 charge!!! And they also charged twice to everyone on the table...never ever going back there.
author: Javier B.

description: Great ambience, romantic and our server was just ok that's why it didn't get 5 stars. The food is perfect in every way.
author: Chris D.

description:
Our group of three tried numerous dishes - everything was very flavorful. Don't miss the potato gratin dish - omg. And of course have a glass of cava. 

John is an excellent server! He made it very fun.
author: Vicki L.

description:
My wife and I ate at Piperade before going to a comedy show at the Punchline (about 6 blocks away).  We arrived pretty early (6:15) and so the restaurant was fairly quiet, though definitely not empty.

I started with the garlic soup, which consisted of rock shrimp, bacon, egg and bread.  It wasn't quite what I was expecting, somehow, but was pretty good.  Not sure I would order it a second time, though.

For the main course, my wife had the duck and I had the New York steak.  My steak was excellent.  It came with a piquillo and shallot "jam" on top, as well as fried potatoes and portabello mushrooms.  Yum.  My wife's duck was good, but a bit dry (she ordered it cooked medium, but should have gone for medium rare).

We didn't have room (or time) for dessert.

Overall, this was a pleasant meal and we would definitely come back.  I waffled on 3 versus 4 stars, but decided on 3 for this review and will update when we go back.
author: Richard M.

description:
"A rainy Friday is better than a sunny Tuesday." Very true. As is "everyone deserves a second chance". Especially when the new manager invites you back, perhaps inspired to "put things right that once went wrong". Bonus points for you if you remember that from the excellent television show Quantum Leap.

But enough of the quotes. My second visit was so much better. Super friendly service before they even knew who I was, and an engaging and spirited conversation about the wonderful thing that is the SF food scene with the manager. Oh yes, and the sandwich. A very good turkey cranberry. Lots of turkey. Perfect amount of cranberry. There is some culinary regret they were out of the turkey meatball banh mi, but no one to blame but myself for arriving too late.

Typically this would be four stars, but I'm given an extra one for excellent customer service, being passionate about what they do and for that intro quote, which was written on their menu blackboard. Five star lunch experience, and you can quote me on that.
author: Jason B.

description:
The calamari and piquillo pepper was good.

Everything else was so overloaded with salt that it was basically inedible.

Cocktails sucked.

Service was ok...most if the staff seemed pretty checked out.
author: Nick H.

description: This is a really cool place to dine. Crowd, design, food - you name it, Piperade certainly has it. I ate here for lunch last week, and had the Basque Burger. At $16, it had better be good! I ordered it medium-rare (what else?), and I woofed it down in seconds. The sweet caramelized onions were a nice touch. It must be really nice during dinner hours. I'd probably come back to check out other menu items (lunch and dinner). Parking can be a biatch though. Overall, high-five four-stars.
author: Derek N.

description: Love, love this place!  It is a hidden gem, with excellent food, great service and lovely ambience!
author: TexasAggie A.

description: I'm almost scared to review this restaurant because it's such a hidden gem for me. I absolutely love it. I love, love the way they prepare the steak, great compliment veggies for the side. The onion tart was delious as well as the mussell salad. @Danielle W, I agree, it's not a suitable for girls night out, it's very conservative, you can actually hear what your partner is saying. It's a lovely relief from the crazy trendy packed restaurants in NYC that I've been dealing with for the last 4 years. Go there to eat great food, enjoy the tasteful decor and enjoy the company that you keep. It's a great date night place as well as champagne on the patio. Enjoy but don't go crazy....
author: Teisha F.

description: Excellent service, very friendly, professional and prompt.   It your average Spanish food (because it is Basque).  Must try the house cocktails.  Delicious food from appetiZers thru to dessert.  Had dinner here on the evening of our wedding.  Very nice and quiet.
author: Eric L.

description:
Good food, small plates.  For my taste, there are a few too many cold appetizers; I would prefer more hot dishes to choose from.  My wife had a sea bass dish to her satisfaction - nicely cooked and fresh.  House wine was great and complimented our dishes well.

Service was very attentive and complaints.
author: Darius A.

description: This meal was fantastic - one of the best I've had in a long time! The service was great, as was the food. For appetizers, we got the piquillo peppers and dungeness crab. For entrees, the braised shellfish & seafood soup (so incredibly delicious and perfectly cooked), and the roasted rack of lamb. For desserts, the gateau basque and the orange blossom beignets. The only thing that I would not order again was the gateau basque. Other than that, everything was perfect. I highly, highly recommend!
author: Naomi F.

description: Unfortunately, the service has gone downhill. We had eaten before with Travel zoo and had good food and service. Last night we had Travelzoo again and had good food but disappointing service. Forgotten drinks and then the waiter disappeared. We had a birthday which I mentioned during the reservation and not even a candle. We will not be going back.
author: Tina S.

description:
Plenty of fancy restaurants that don't meet the hype - this one however, does deliver on the promised yumminess and it does so with simple, fresh ingredients brought together to make sophisticated yet rustic-like dishes full of flavor.

A must to try is their: Garlic Soup with Rock Shrimp, Bacon, Bread, Egg!
Pipérade is delish! Their calamari "Txipiroa" with ink sauce and rice took me back to some of the best food I've ever eaten in my life - that being in San Sebastian (Donostia).

Desserts: Gâteau Basque, Cherry Preserve and Dark Chocolate Cake "Amatxi" & Crème Fraîche - were outstanding!

I'm a fan!
author: Stephania R.

description:
Honestly, I think I would just order appetizers and desserts when I come here.  The prices are higher than I expected.  But if you're willing to pay this much, then Piperade is worth visiting.

I came here with two friends and we ordered the calamari, soup of the day and the butter lettuce salad.  The soup was potato leek soup, and just a bit of advice, if you're expecting the traditional creamy type of soup, this isn't it.  This pretty much tasted like vegetable soup with a clear broth.  The other apps were good.

We each ordered an entree.  I had the rockfish, and I will say that the quality of the fish was great, but it lacked flavor. 

I was most excited about the dessert.  We had the orange blossom beignets and the 'koka' (which is flan).  The beignets were delicately flavored and the flan was rich and creamy.  Definitely worth it.  Desserts are $8 each.

I would go back because I want to try more of the apps and desserts.
author: Suzi F.

description:
I've been here a few times during their lunch rush and I absolutely love it  here. The place does get a little packed so if you're dining in a group of more than 2, it's probably best to make  reservations. There's outside and inside dining which are both nice and the food is very tasty. Reasonably priced and you'll walk away very satisfied. 

Get the Mr. Williams sandwich with pomme frites and you won't be sorry! Mr. Williams is a crusted chicken sandwich which comes with a small salad served on the side of the plate.  YUMMY! Oh and don't forget the orange blossom beignets- they'll melt in your mouth.

*Would've given the place 5 stars, but they're wait on the food is a little slow. But don't let that deter you- the food here is great!
author: Gracie Q.

description:
I really loved this restaurant. Everything (except the desserts) was a home run. Everything from the Poached Foie Gras to the rack of lamb to the Veal stew was tasty, hearty, and quite delicious. 

I was expecting a bit from the desserts, especially if Michael Bauer raved about the Beignets, but desserts were nothing special. 

Service was great, but nothing too outstanding. Restaurant was fairly spacious and not too cramped, most or all the tables were for 4 people, so seating 2 at a 4-seater made it feel spacious. The crowd is also very energetic and makes you want to just stay and linger on for a little while after your meal
author: Justin L.

description:
This little tucked away restaurant is a gem.  With great appetizers (especially the calamari with this awesome tapenade sauce.)  All the dishes were very tasty including the lamb and the duck. 

Come with friends so you can all taste each others plates! 

The desserts are just so-so. 

Oh! Btw $20 corkage.
author: Lauren B.

description:
I've heard a lot about Piperade so I was so excited to finally try it. I also haven't been to too many Spanish Basque restaurants so that added to my excitement.

First of all, the chef/owner, Gerald Hirigoyen is so sweet. When we got there, he was playing host and kept making sure we were happy with our food and our service. Their service in general was awesome and they understood how food lovers love to eat. We like to share. So our waiter always made sure we had extra small plates so we can try each other's dishes.

For appetizers, we had their Serrano Ham and they give you a very generous heap of this. Awesome. Also ordered their roasted piquillo peppers stuffed with goat cheese and served with golden raisins and pistachio. I never realized how well roasted peppers went with golden raisins. This was delicious. I think my favorite was the foie gras with rhubarb compote though. I've never had foie gras with rhubarb so this was an eye opener for me. The flavors were so complimentary I couldn't stop eating it.

For the main dish, I ordered their Tuesday Special which was calamari with roasted peppers rice and squid ink. Now this was AMAZING. I've always been a huge fan of squid ink anything so when I took the first bite, I was in heaven. The squid was cooked perfectly and went really well with the roasted pepper, rice and ink. When you combined all four together in your mouth, you just didn't want the dish to end. The rock fish with spinach that my boyfriend ordered wasn't very good. The spinach was very chalky. A little disappointing. BUT my other friend's dish, duck with cherries and sunchokes was another amazing dish. I highly recommend that too.

For dessert, I had their Gateau Basque (of course) with bing cherries. This was an awesome way to end my perfect dinner. I'm looking forward to the next time I come here. I fell in love with this place. The restaurant is nice and homey and the food has that homey flavor too.
author: Yokes F.

description:
Great place tucked away from just far enough that you have to know where it is to find it.  Had a lunch interview here and both my interviewer and I came away very satisfied with the food.

I always believe that if a restaurant is willing to stick their name in front of one particular dish then that is the dish I need to get.  It's kinda like a fancy restaurant's way of putting a gold star next to the dish they like the best.  I had the Piperade Sauteed Serrano Ham w/ Poached Egg.  It was fantastic.  It had a bunch of sweet peppers in the dish and the tastes all came together in a great way.  The butter lettuces salad was just ok, but the main course more than made up for a so-so salad.  Prices were a little high for lunch, but it is a really nice place and the food was worth it.
author: Brian G.

description:
My family stumbled up on Piperade one hungry night based on good yelp reviews and a need to eat somewhere close.  IT IS AMAZING!  The food here is incredible.  I have eaten here multiple times and have never had a bad dish.  The first time I came here I had the mushroom tart (one of the best dishes I've ever eaten) and a dish with sausage and potatoes.  SO GOOD.  We also got a great bottle of red wine from the Basque region.  I've been back multiple times and it remains delicious each time.  For every occasion we can think of my family comes here to enjoy an amazing meal and relax.  

The prices are steep but you actually get what you pay for here.  There are a lot of expensive restaurants in the city that can't deliver on the food but this place isn't one of them.  I would recommend reservations, especially if you have a party over two.
author: Madeline W.

description:
It seems that I've been following the yellow brick road of much written and Yelped about places. What to do... follow, follow, follow and add another 4 stars!

I live on T-Hill and although I'm right off of Union and so is Pipérade, we are 500 steps and a hillside apart. I guess that doesn't really make us that close! So the other night I thew on a pair of flats, stuffed my heels into my purse to thwart off the Clutz Clause, and set out on a nice walk down the Filbert Steps.

Pipérade, the sister restaurant to Bocadillos, is casually decorated with architectural warmth and sports a similarly styled menu. Brick walls (like many FinDi buildings), low ceilings, raw wood beams, and a "chandelier" of empty wine bottles had me momentarily transferred to wine country. There was a good mix of ages present and my people watching radar was tuned up high. Most unusual spotting: A white haired man dressed in white pants, white leather motorcycle jacket holding a white double wine carrier. Sean Connery couldn't have been smoother.

Well, let's get right to it. I decided to lean towards tradition and went with their famed Garlic Soup and signature dish of Pipérade. "Huh?" That's what I said. So, I Wikipedia'ed it on my phone while sitting in front of the menu. Oh yeah, I'm totally "THAT person"! And so you don't have to be, here's what Pipérade is:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piperade

Don't you feel better now? It was just as they say: a wonderful combination of bright, peppery flavors with light fluffy pieces of egg, a yolk to break, and jamon sarrano. It served as a nice accompaniment to Monday's special of Sweet Breads, which I recommend sharing. Both dishes were tasty, but to eat that many slippery lumps of lamb in one sitting could quite seriously make a person ill! As to their Garlic Soup, it was so glorious that I gave mine up to the Birthday Guest of Honor. I reluctantly ate a bowl of the Potato Leek soup, which we all agreed screamed for a little salt and pepper, and then wished it had been my birthday.

They kindly let us stay til the lights went out in the kitchen and our server, who taught us a little Basque, was lookin' like a Monday night was just not the same as Saturday. Sometimes a 3 hour dinner is just what you need!
author: Kira R.

description: Had a delicious seared tuna sandwich, crab salad and white wine for lunch with my dad.  Very busy with dressed up crowd, for lunch (!)
author: Minori S.

description: The food we ate was delicious.  We started with the mushroom tart and loved it.  I had the snapper on spinach.  Large portions and very tasty.  My guest had the chicken and thought it was very tasty. We had early reservations, so the service was very good too.  A bit pricey, but so are most nice restaurants.
author: Lois L.

description: Always a fun place to go and relax after work. With a glass of wine, glass of beer or cocktail... It's a must. Service is ok most of the time, if you sit outside they dont always pay attention. But when they do they are amazing. Must try at some point for sure. Not too expensive and affordable
author: Rosie S.

description:
Came here for a biz dinner last night & was thoroughly impressed

Knowing there would be no veggie entree available ( thanks Yelp! ), I settled into the Small Plate section & found 2 scrumptious delights - 

Asparagus Salad w/ Asparagus Flan & Tarragon Mousseline - the asparagus spears were cooked just right - not too mushy & the flan - OMG was it tasty....tart & salty & creamy all at the same time & paired perfectly w/ the spears

Piquillo Peppers Stuffed w/ Warm Goat Cheese, Pine Nuts & Golden Raisins - another winner here......tender red pepper w/ warmed, soft goat cheese, tender & chewy pine nuts made even better w/ the sweet, chewy, & plump raisins

Others in our party got the Poached Foie Gras & the Mussel Salad & said they were delightful

Others' entrees consisted of Lamb Chop & Steak - again talk among the group of absolute deliciousness

Dessert was at the recommendation of our waiter.  All 3 of us indulged & couldn't have been a better choice - Turron Mousse Cake w/ Roasted Almonds

Like an almondy-flan (even before the actual almonds) that wasn't too sweet but when you scraped the caramel drizzle off the plate, the flavor was boosted ten-fold

Atmosphere was extremely pleasant & our server was attentive w/out being overly so

Glass of delish Pinot & this dinner was da bomb - would totally come back!  And a 5th star would definitely be warranted once there's a Veggie Entree!
author: Adrienne G.

description: This was amazing food! And we had the best server. We just did 5 appetizers and the Gateau Basque with Cherry Preserves dessert. Yum!
author: Kate M.

description: Every dish we had was delicious. For apps: Calamari, Herring, red peper and crab cakes; main course: roasted lamb, steak, duck confit and tilapia, and to top it off the dessert: Milk and hazelnut cake, and dark chocolate cake.... Def will return for this delicious food!
author: christine j.

description: Excellent service and food. Reasonable corkage fee, no max # of bottles, and attitude for bringing your own. Perfect set up with the small plates to try lots of wine. Might be my favorite place for a 'winey' dinner
author: Justin H.

description: the food was OK to tasty, reasonably but not over-creative, but small portions at high prices. The atmosphere was a bit stuffy for my tastes yet still rather loud. I enjoyed it OK but did not digest it well. I have gluten and other digestive issues which become more difficult to control at restaurants which are too "creative" where all the ingredients are not evident.
author: Asher B.

description:
My wife and I arrived 1/2 hour before reservation time of 8:00 to join our friends for a drink at the bar.  The evening got off to a bit of a rocky start, as the Ukranian hostess with a former Soviet Block attitude asked if we wanted to be seated early.  We told her that we wanted to enjoy a drink at the bar and would like to be seated at our resy time.   Meanwhile, she seats another party in our seat at 7:55 without asking us if we wanted to give up our seat!!!  Anyway, I raised a bit of a stink, because we then didn't get seated until 8:15 or so.

Aside from that, our evening was fantastic!!!  The atmosphere there feels like Barcelona.  It is warm and cozzy with exposed brick and heavy timber ceilings.  The large windows look out onto Battery St., which is deserted on a weekend night.

Our waiter was excellent and the consumate professional.  He is from France, and he was very knowledgable about the menu.  He helped us choose the first course and the wine, which were all excellent:

Hericot Verts -- had a surprising hint of mint.  Delish!
Calamari -- perfectly cooked squid with a perfect almond tomato sauce.
Stuffed Peppers -- great blend of flavors with the cheese inside.
Tomato Tart -- Wow!!!  The cherry tomatoes were very sweet.

The second course was also very good.  I enjoyed the seafood stew, and my brother in law had the lamb, which was perfectly cookedl.  The ladies had the piperade (described by our waiter as ratatoulle without the eggplant) and the halibut.

The best part was the dessert.  The begneits were just as good as other Yelpers have described.  I also really enjoyed the the apple tart with a dark carmelized sugar drizzle.

The waiter surpised us by bringing us some very nice sparkling Muscat with our dessert as an apology for the issue we had with the hostess.  That was a great gesture!!

All and all, an excellent evening!!
author: Donnie Mac M.

description:
When my supervisor sees waning morale on my part, lack of visuals passing by the window to keep the brain motivated or feels like its time to renew the bonds of comradery, we do something innovative called getting lunch where we reaffirm our allegiances and add a new wrinkle to our handshake.  

Our retired annuitant happened to be running with that day's wolfpack and that called for a celebration.  There is such an abundance of restaurants along the FiDi that you can eat at a new place everyday for probably a year.  We arrived at this Basque restaurant for an early lunch, warmly greeted and led to our table.  This was an introduction to Basque cuisine, which reviewing the menu and Wikipedia, is heavy on peppers and cheese.  I ordered the sheep milk cheese with ham terrine with aged sherry and the basque burger.  The ED ordered the piquillo peppers stuffed with goat cheese and a basque burger.  The retired annuitant ordered the seared tuna salad.  The basque burger came with piperade and upon inquiry, learned that it is very similar to ratatouille.  

The sheep milk cheese was so savory and one of the best appetizers I have ever eaten.  It is layered with ham terrine and quite intricate in presentation.  In addition, it came with a bed of something that tasted like thinly cut apple slices.  The sheep's milk cheese was not overpowering, yet, unlike any other cheese I've eaten.  That's not saying much as I have recently discovered a taste for it.  My only experiences are: cheddar, jack, mozzarella, Parmesan, provolone, Gorgonzola, goat and now this.  My knowledge of cheese is not vast at all.  This is an appetizer that you have to get.  The piquillo stuffed pepper was also delicious.  Its innards ozzed with goat cheese.  The Basque burger was big, however, the patty was not as flavorful as a gourmet burger should be.  Being a frites connoisseur, these fries were rather limp.  The piperade ketchup was very intense in flavor.  It tasted like spiced tomatoe purree...a very different taste.  It is definitely good in controlled portions, however, I felt that it did not serve as a good dipping sauce for my frites.
